text: We are having class / a lesson.

translate: Det er interessant å lære språk.

text: We want to speak with people.
translate: Vi ønsker å snakke med folk.

text: We only work for five days.
He is here and she is here.
translate: Han er her og hun er her.

text: I was at the cinema yesterday.
translate: I går var jeg på kino.
I morgen må jeg på jobb igjen.

text: In which hotel are you staying?
How long have you been here for?
translate: Hvor lenge har du vært her?

text: How long will you be staying?
translate: Hvor lenge skal du være her?
Du må besøke meg en gang!

text: Shall we see each other tomorrow?
I am sorry, but I already have plans.

translate: Ha det! / Ha det bra! / Ha det godt!

text: Where do they like to go?
They like to listen to music.
translate: De liker å høre på musikk.

text: Where do they not like to go?
translate: Hvor liker de ikke å gå?

text: They do not like to dance.
What colour / color (am.) is the snow? White.
What colour / color (am.) is the sun? Yellow.
What colour / color (am.) is the orange? Orange.
What colour / color (am.) is the cherry? Red.
What colour / color (am.) is the sky? Blue.
I have a kiwi and a melon.
translate: Jeg har en kiwi og en melon.

text: I have an orange and a grapefruit.
translate: Jeg har en appelsin og en grapefrukt.

text: I have an apple and a mango.
translate: Jeg har et eple og en mango.

text: What colour / color (am.) is the grass? Green.
What colour / color (am.) is the earth? Brown.
What colour / color (am.) is the cloud? Grey / Gray (am.).
What colour / color (am.) are the tyres / tires (am.)? Black.
I have a banana and a pineapple.
translate: Jeg har en banan og en ananas.

text: I am making a fruit salad.
I am eating toast with butter.
translate: Jeg spiser en toast med smør.

text: I am eating toast with butter and jam.
translate: Jeg spiser en toast med smør og syltetøy.

text: I am eating a sandwich with margarine.
translate: Jeg spiser et smørbrød med margarin.

text: I am eating a sandwich with margarine and tomatoes.
translate: Jeg spiser et smørbrød med margarin og tomat.

text: We need carrots and tomatoes for the soup.
translate: Vi trenger gulrøtter og tomater til suppen.

text: We like to go for a walk in summer.
translate: Om sommeren går vi gjerne tur.

text: It snows or rains in winter.
translate: Om vinteren snør og regner det.

text: We like to stay home in winter.
translate: Om vinteren blir vi gjerne hjemme.

text: What is the weather like today?
We are cleaning the apartment today.
My husband is washing the car.
The children are cleaning the bicycles.
The children are cleaning up the children’s room.
My husband is tidying up his desk.
translate: Mannen min rydder på skrivebordet sitt.

text: I am putting the laundry in the washing machine.
translate: Jeg putter tøy inn i vaskemaskinen.

text: I am hanging up the laundry.
There is a garden behind the house.
translate: Bak huset er det en hage.

text: There is no street in front of the house.
translate: Foran huset er det ingen gate.

text: There are trees next to the house.
translate: Ved siden av huset står det trær.

text: The kitchen and bathroom are here.
The living room and bedroom are there.
We are going to the living room.
There is a sofa and an armchair there.
translate: Der er det en sofa og en lenestol.

text: Do you have a new kitchen?
What do you want to cook today?
translate: Hva skal du lage i dag?

text: Do you cook on an electric or a gas stove?
translate: Bruker du elektrisk komfyr eller gasskomfyr?

text: The TV set is brand new.
Do you have a tin opener / can opener (am.)?
Do you have a bottle opener?
Are you cooking the soup in this pot?
translate: Koker du suppen i denne gryten?

text: Are you frying the fish in this pan?
translate: Steker du fisken i denne pannen?

text: Are you grilling the vegetables on this grill?
translate: Griller du grønnsakene på denne grillen?

text: Here are the knives, the forks and the spoons.
translate: Her er knivene, gaflene og skjeene.

text: Here are the glasses, the plates and the napkins.
translate: Her er glassene, tallerkene og serviettene.

text: Do you drink tea with lemon?
Do you drink coffee with sugar?
Do you drink water with ice?
People are drinking wine and beer.
Do you drink Coke with rum?
The child likes cocoa and apple juice.
The woman likes orange and grapefruit juice.

translate: Lat som om du var hjemme!

text: What would you like to drink?
Do you play a musical instrument?
I am currently reading this book.
translate: Jeg holder på å lese denne boken.

text: What do you like to read?
Do you like to go to concerts?
translate: Liker du å gå på konsert?

text: Do you like to go to the theatre / theater (am.)?
translate: Liker du å gå i teateret?

text: Do you like to go to the opera?
translate: Liker du å gå i operaen?

text: Yes, and I also speak some Italian.
translate: Ja, og jeg kan litt italiensk også.

text: I think you speak very well.
translate: Jeg synes du snakker veldig bra.

text: But speaking and writing is difficult.
translate: Men å snakke og skrive er vanskelig.
Du må alltid korrigere meg, takk.

text: You only have a slight accent.
One can tell where you come from.
translate: Man kan høre hvor du kommer fra.

text: What is your mother tongue / native language (am.)?
Are you taking a language course?
I don’t remember the name right now.
translate: Jeg kommer ikke på hva den heter akkurat nå.

text: The title is not coming to me.

translate: Men jeg røyker ikke nå lenger.

text: Does it disturb you if I smoke?
translate: Forstyrrer det deg at jeg røyker?
Nei da, ikke i det hele tatt.
Nei, jeg tar heller en øl.
Men nå er vi på ferie.
Ja, i dag er det virkelig varmt.
La oss gå ut på balkongen.
I morgen er det fest her.
Ja, vi er invitert, vi også .

text: Are you here for the first time?
translate: Er det første gang du er her?

text: No, I was here once last year.
translate: Nei, jeg var her i fjor også.

text: How do you like it here?
translate: Hvordan liker du deg her hos oss?

text: A lot. The people are nice.
And I like the scenery, too.
No, my wife / my husband is also here.
translate: Nei, kona mi / mannen min er her også.

text: And those are my two children.
translate: Og der er de to barna mine.

text: Do you see the tower there?
Do you see the mountain there?
Do you see the village there?
Do you see the river there?
Do you see the bridge there?
Do you see the lake there?

translate: Det kommer ikke noe varmt vann her.

text: There is no telephone in the room.
translate: Det finnes ikke telefon på rommet.

text: There is no TV in the room.
translate: Det finnes ikke TV på rommet.
Det synes jeg er for dyrt.

text: Is there a youth hostel nearby?
translate: Finnes det et ungdomsherberge i nærheten?

text: Is there a boarding house / a bed and breakfast nearby?
translate: Finnes det et pensjonat i nærheten?
Finnes det en restaurant i nærheten?

text: I waited for you for half an hour.
translate: Jeg har ventet på deg i en halv time.

text: Don’t you have a mobile / cell phone (am.) with you?
translate: Har du ikke mobilen med deg?

text: Take an umbrella with you next time!
translate: Ta med deg paraply neste gang!

text: I have the day off tomorrow.
I’m sorry, I can’t make it tomorrow.
translate: Beklager, jeg kan ikke i morgen.

text: Do you already have plans for this weekend?
translate: Har du noen planer i helga?

text: Or do you already have an appointment?
translate: Eller har du allerede en avtale?

text: I suggest that we meet on the weekend.
translate: Jeg foreslår at vi møtes i helga.

text: Shall we go to the beach?
Shall we go to the mountains?
I will pick you up at the office.
I will pick you up at home.
translate: Jeg henter deg hjemme hos deg.

text: I will pick you up at the bus stop.
Peter and Martha are from Berlin.
translate: Peter og Martha kommer fra Berlin.

text: Do both of you speak German?
Madrid and Berlin are also capital cities.
translate: Madrid og Berlin er også hovedsteder.

text: Capital cities are big and noisy.
I’d like a glass of red wine.
translate: Jeg vil gjerne ha et glass rødvin.

text: I’d like a glass of white wine.
translate: Jeg vil gjerne ha et glass hvitvin.

text: I’d like a bottle of champagne.
translate: Jeg vil gjerne ha en flaske musserende.
Jeg vil gjerne ha noe uten kjøtt.
Jeg vil gjerne ha en grønnsaktallerken.

text: I’d like something that won’t take much time.
translate: Jeg vil gjerne ha noe som ikke tar lang tid.

text: Would you like that with rice?
Would you like that with pasta?
Would you like that with potatoes?

translate: Jeg vil gjerne ha en forrett.
Jeg vil gjerne ha en salat.
Jeg vil gjerne ha en suppe.
Det var ikke det jeg bestilte.

text: I would like an ice cream with whipped cream.
translate: Jeg vil gjerne ha is med kremfløte.

text: I would like some fruit or cheese.
translate: Jeg vil gjerne ha frukt eller ost.

text: We would like to have breakfast.
We would like to have lunch.
We would like to have dinner.
What would you like for breakfast?
translate: Hva ønsker du å ha til frokost?

text: Some salt and pepper also, please.
translate: Kan jeg få salt og pepper?
Kan jeg få et glass vann?

text: I’d like chips / French fries (am.) with ketchup.
translate: En porsjon pommes frites med ketchup.

text: Do you also like to eat leek?
Do you also like to eat sauerkraut?
Do you also like to eat lentils?
Do you also like to eat carrots?
Do you also like to eat broccoli?
Do you also like to eat peppers?
I’d like to book a flight to Athens.
translate: Jeg vil bestille en flytur til Athen.
Jeg ønsker en vindusplass, ikke-røyker, takk.

text: I would like to confirm my reservation.
translate: Jeg ønsker å bekrefte bestillingen min.

text: I would like to cancel my reservation.
translate: Jeg ønsker å kansellere bestillingen min.

text: I would like to change my reservation.
translate: Jeg ønsker å endre bestillingen min.

text: When is the next flight to Rome?
translate: Når går neste fly til Roma?

text: No, we have only one seat available.
translate: Nei, vi har bare en ledig plass.

text: When does a bus go to the city centre / center (am.)?
translate: Når går det buss til sentrum?

text: How much luggage can I take?
translate: Hvor mye bagasje kan jeg ta med?

text: Is that the train to Berlin?
When does the train arrive in Berlin?
translate: Når/Hvilken tid ankommer toget i Berlin?
Unnskyld, kan jeg få komme meg forbi?

text: I think this is my seat.
translate: Jeg tror dette er min plass.

text: I think you’re sitting in my seat.
translate: Jeg tror du sitter på plassen min.

text: The sleeper is at the end of the train.
And where is the dining car? – At the front.
translate: Og hvor er spisevognen? – Helt framme i toget.

text: Can I sleep in the middle?
translate: Kan jeg få sove i midten?

text: Can I sleep at the top?
When will we get to the border?
translate: Når er vi fremme ved grensen?

text: How long does the journey to Berlin take?
translate: Hvor lenge tar turen til Berlin?

text: Do you have something to read?
Can one get something to eat and to drink here?
translate: Går det an å få noe mat og drikke her?

text: Could you please wake me up at 7 o’clock?
translate: Kan du vennligst vekke meg klokka sju?

text: When is the next train to Berlin?
translate: Når går neste tog til Berlin?

text: When is the next train to Paris?
translate: Når går neste tog til Paris?

text: When is the next train to London?
translate: Når går neste tog til London?

text: When does the train for Warsaw leave?
When does the train for Stockholm leave?
When does the train for Budapest leave?
I’d like a ticket to Madrid.
I’d like a ticket to Prague.
I’d like a ticket to Bern.

When does the train arrive in Moscow?
When does the train arrive in Amsterdam?
Do I have to change trains?
From which platform does the train leave?

translate: Jeg vil kjøpe tur til Brüssel.

text: I’d like a return ticket to Copenhagen.
translate: Jeg vil kjøpe retur til København.

text: What does a berth in the sleeper cost?

text: Which bus goes to the city centre / center (am.)?
Which bus do I have to take?
Where do I have to change?
How much does a ticket cost?
How many stops are there before downtown / the city centre?
translate: Hvor mange stopp er det til sentrum?

text: You have to get off here.
You have to get off at the back.
The next train is in 5 minutes.
translate: Neste T-bane kommer om fem minutter.

text: The next tram is in 10 minutes.
translate: Neste trikk kommer om ti minutter.

text: The next bus is in 15 minutes.
translate: Neste buss kommer om femten minutter.

text: A ticket? – No, I don’t have one.
translate: Billett? – Nei, det har jeg ikke.

text: Then you have to pay a fine.
Do you have a vacant room?
What does the room cost per night?
I would like a room with a bathroom.
translate: Jeg ønsker et rom med bad.

text: I would like a room with a shower.
translate: Jeg ønsker et rom med dusj.
Kan jeg få se på rommet?

text: Is there a fax machine here?
I would like to go to the station.
I would like to go to the airport.
I would like to go to the city centre / center (am.).
How do I get to the station?

What time do you serve lunch?
What time do you serve dinner?
How do I get to the airport?
How do I get to the city centre / center (am.)?
I would like to rent a car.
translate: Jeg ønsker å leie en bil.

text: What is there to see in the city?
translate: Hva er det å se i byen?

text: Go on a harbour / harbor (am.) tour.
Are there any other places of interest?
I would like the menu, please.

translate: Jeg vil gjerne ha en øl.
Jeg vil gjerne ha et mineralvann.
Jeg vil gjerne ha en appelsinjuice.
Jeg vil gjerne ha en kaffe.

text: I’d like a coffee with milk.
translate: Jeg vil gjerne ha en kaffe med melk.
Jeg vil gjerne ha en te.

text: I’d like a tea with lemon.
translate: Jeg vil gjerne ha en te med sitron.

text: I’d like a tea with milk.
translate: Jeg vil gjerne ha en te med melk.

text: I also have a video camera.
Where can I find a battery?
There is a café over there.
There is a restaurant over there.
Where are the gorillas and the zebras?
Where are the tigers and the crocodiles?

Is the fair open on Mondays?
Is the exhibition open on Tuesdays?
Is the zoo open on Wednesdays?
Is the museum open on Thursdays?
Is the gallery open on Fridays?

translate: Er det lov å ta bilder?

text: Does one have to pay an entrance fee?
How much is the entrance fee?
Is there a discount for groups?
Is there a discount for children?
Is there a discount for students?
Where is the next gas station?
I have a flat tyre / tire (am.).
Can you change the tyre / tire (am.)?
I need a few litres / liters (am.) of diesel.
translate: Jeg trenger et par liter diesel.

text: I have no more petrol / gas (am.).
Do you have a petrol can / jerry can / gas can (am.)?
translate: Har du en reservekanne med bensin?

text: Where can I make a call?
Do you have a mobile / cell phone (am.) with you?

translate: Kan jeg få se papirene dine?

text: We want to go to the cinema.
A good film is playing today.
translate: I dag går det en god film.

text: How much are the admission tickets?
I want to sit at the back.
I want to sit at the front.
I want to sit in the middle.
But the book on which the film was based was better.
translate: Men boka til filmen var bedre.

text: What’s playing at the theatre / theater (am.) this evening?
translate: Hva skjer på teateret i kveld?

text: What’s playing at the cinema / movies (am.) this evening?
translate: Hva er det på kino i kveld?
Hva er det på TV i kveld?

text: Are tickets for the theatre / theater (am.) still available?
translate: Er det billetter igjen til teateret?

text: Are tickets for the cinema / movies (am.) still available?
translate: Er det billetter igjen til kinoen?

text: Are tickets for the football / soccer am. game still available?
translate: Er det billetter igjen til fotballkampen?

text: I want to sit in the back.
I want to sit somewhere in the middle.
translate: Jeg vil sitte en eller annen plass i midten.

text: I want to sit at the front.
Can you get me a ticket?
translate: Kan du skaffe meg en billett?

text: Is there a golf course nearby?
translate: Finnes det en golfbane her i nærheten?

text: Is there a tennis court nearby?
translate: Finnes det en tennisbane her i nærheten?

text: Is there an indoor swimming pool nearby?
translate: Finnes det en svømmehall her i nærheten?

text: How do you like the music?
But the band plays very well.
No, this is the first time.

translate: Jeg er ikke så flink til å danse.

text: Where is the tourist information office?
Do you have a city map for me?
Can one reserve a room here?
translate: Kan jeg bestille et hotellrom her?

text: I would like a guide who speaks German.
translate: Jeg ønsker en guide som snakker tysk.

text: I would like a guide who speaks Italian.
translate: Jeg ønsker en guide som snakker italiensk.

text: I would like a guide who speaks French.
translate: Jeg ønsker en guide som snakker fransk.

text: Is it dangerous to hitchhike alone?
translate: Er det farlig å haike alene?

text: Is it dangerous to go for a walk at night?
translate: Er et farlig å gå tur om natten?
Går det an å bade der?

text: Isn’t it dangerous to swim there?
translate: Er det ikke farlig å bade der?

text: Is there a parking lot here?
How long can one park here?
translate: Hvor lenge kan man parkere her?

text: Do you take the ski lift to the top?

translate: Går det an å leie ski her?

text: Can one rent a sun umbrella / parasol here?
translate: Kan man leie en parasol her?

text: Can one rent a deck chair here?
translate: Kan man leie en liggestol her?

text: Can one rent a boat here?
translate: Kan man leie en båt her?

text: I would like to water ski.
translate: Jeg vil gjerne stå på vannski.
Går det an å leie surfebrett?
Går det an å leie dykkerutstyr?
Går det an å leie vannskier?

text: I am a member of a sports club.
There is a football / soccer (am.) stadium in our city.
translate: I byen vår finnes det en fotballstadion.

text: There is also a swimming pool with a sauna.
translate: Det finnes også en svømmehall med badstue.

text: And there is a golf course.
There is a football / soccer (am.) match on now.
The German team is playing against the English one.
translate: Det tyske laget spiller mot det engelske.

text: Is there a good restaurant around here?
translate: Hvor finner jeg en god restaurant her?

text: Take a left at the corner.
Then go straight for a while.
translate: Gå så et stykke rett fram.

text: Then go right for a hundred metres / meters (am.).
translate: Gå så hundre meter til høyre.

text: You can also take the bus.
You can also take the tram.
You can also follow me with your car.
translate: Du kan bare kjøre etter meg.

text: How do I get to the football / soccer (am.) stadium?
Drive until you reach the third traffic light.
translate: Kjør til du kommer til det tredje lyskrysset.

text: Then turn into the first street on your right.
translate: Ta så første veien til høyre.

text: Then drive straight through the next intersection.
translate: Kjør deretter rett fram ved det neste krysset.

text: Excuse me, how do I get to the airport?
translate: Unnskyld, hvordan kommer jeg til flyplassen?

text: It is best if you take the underground / subway (am.).
translate: Det er best du tar T-banen.

text: Simply get out at the last stop.
Shall we go to the swimming pool?
Do you have a bathing suit?
Can you jump in the water?
I am getting out of the water now.
translate: Jeg skal opp av vannet nå.

text: We’re looking for a sports shop.
We’re looking for a butcher shop.
We’re looking for a pharmacy / drugstore (am.).
We want to buy a football.
translate: Vi skal nemlig kjøpe en fotball.

text: We’re looking for a sports shop to buy a football.
translate: Vi leter etter en sportsforretning for å kjøpe en fotball.

text: We’re looking for a butcher shop to buy salami.
translate: Vi leter etter en kjøttforretning for å kjøpe salami.

text: We’re looking for a drugstore to buy medicine.
translate: Vi leter etter et apotek for å kjøpe medikamenter.

text: I’m looking for a jeweller / jeweler (am.).
I’m looking for a photo equipment store.
I actually plan to buy a ring.
translate: Jeg har nemlig tenkt å kjøpe en ring.

text: I actually plan to buy a roll of film.
translate: Jeg har nemlig tenkt å kjøpe en film.
Kan du vennligst bestille en drosje?

text: What does it cost to go to the station?
What does it cost to go to the airport?
I actually plan to buy a cake.
translate: Jeg har nemlig tenkt å kjøpe en bløtkake.

text: I’m looking for a jeweler to buy a ring.
translate: Jeg leter etter en gullsmed for å kjøpe en ring.

text: I’m looking for a photo shop to buy a roll of film.
translate: Jeg leter etter en fotoforretning for å kjøpe en film.

text: I’m looking for a confectionery to buy a cake.
translate: Jeg leter etter et konditori for å kjøpe en bløtkake.

text: Please turn left at the corner.
translate: Vennligst kjør til venstre der ved hjørnet.

text: That is okay, please keep the change.
I want to buy a present.
A large one or a small one?
May I see this one, please?
translate: Kan jeg få se på denne?

text: Or is it made of plastic?
And the bag is really very reasonable.
translate: Og denne vesken er virkelig rimelig.

text: Shall we go to the department store?
Can I exchange it if needed?

translate: Vi kan pakke den inn som preseng.

text: I want to do a lot of shopping.
I need a cupboard and a chest of drawers.
translate: Jeg trenger et skap og en kommode.

text: I need a desk and a bookshelf.
translate: Jeg trenger et skrivebord og en hylle.

text: I need a doll and a teddy bear.
translate: Jeg trenger ei dukke og en bamse.

text: I need a football and a chess board.
translate: Jeg trenger en fotball og et sjakkspill.

text: I need a hammer and a pair of pliers.
translate: Jeg trenger en hammer og ei tang.

text: I need a drill and a screwdriver.
translate: Jeg trenger et bor og en skrutrekker.

text: Where is the jewellery / jewelry (am.) department?
I need a chain and a bracelet.
translate: Jeg trenger en halskjede og et armbånd.

text: I need a ring and earrings.
translate: Jeg trenger en ring og øredobber.

text: What do you do for a living?
I work as a nurse part-time.
We will soon receive our pension.
What would you like to become some day?
translate: Hva har du lyst til å bli?

text: I would like to become an engineer.
I want to go to college.
I am doing an internship abroad.
We always go to the cafeteria at noon.
I am looking for a job.
I have already been unemployed for a year.
translate: Jeg har vært arbeidsledig i ett år.

text: There are too many unemployed people in this country.
translate: Her i landet er det for mange arbeidsledige.

text: We feel like. / We want to.
We don’t feel like. / We do’t want to.
I have the appointment at ten o’clock.
Please take a seat in the waiting room.
The doctor is on his way.
What insurance company do you belong to?
What can I do for you?
translate: Hva kan jeg hjelpe deg med?
Jeg har alltid vondt i ryggen.
Jeg har av og til vondt i magen.
Kan du ta av deg toppen / skjorta / genseren?

text: Lie down on the examining table.
translate: Kan du legge deg på benken?

text: I will give you an injection.
I will give you some pills.
I am giving you a prescription for the pharmacy.
translate: Jeg gir deg en resept til apoteket.

text: Where is the nearest post office?
Is the post office far from here?
translate: Er det langt til nærmeste postkontor?

text: Where is the nearest mail box?
I need a couple of stamps.
For a card and a letter.
translate: Til et kort og et brev.

text: How much is the postage to America?
Can I send it by air mail?
translate: Kan jeg sende den per luftpost?

text: How long will it take to get there?
translate: Hvor lenge tar det til det kommer?

text: Where can I make a call?
Where is the nearest telephone booth?
Do you have a telephone directory?
Do you know the area code for Austria?
One moment, I’ll look it up.
You have to dial a zero first!
I would like to open an account.
I want to deposit money in my account.
translate: Jeg ønsker å innbetale penger på kontoen min.

text: I want to withdraw money from my account.
translate: Jeg ønsker å få utbetalt penger fra kontoen min.

text: I want to pick up the bank statements.
I want to cash a traveller’s cheque / traveler’s check (am.).
translate: Jeg ønsker å innløse en reisesjekk.

text: I’m expecting a transfer from Germany.
translate: Jeg venter en overføring fra Tyskland.
Jeg ønsker å veksle disse pengene.

text: Could you please give me small notes / bills (am.)?
translate: Kan jeg få det i små sedler?

text: Is there a cashpoint / an ATM (am.)?
How much money can one withdraw?

text: Which credit cards can one use?
Six months make half a year.
translate: Seks måneder er et halvt år.

text: I want to go to the library.
I want to go to the bookstore.
I want to go to the newspaper stand.
I want to borrow a book.
I want to buy a book.
I want to buy a newspaper.
I want to go to the library to borrow a book.
translate: Jeg skal på biblioteket for å låne ei bok.

text: I want to go to the bookstore to buy a book.
translate: Jeg skal på bokhandelen for å kjøpe ei bok.

text: I want to go to the kiosk / newspaper stand to buy a newspaper.
translate: Jeg skal til kiosken for å kjøpe ei avis.

text: I want to go to the optician.
I want to go to the supermarket.
I want to go to the bakery.
I want to buy some glasses.
I want to buy fruit and vegetables.

text: I want to buy rolls and bread.
translate: Jeg skal kjøpe rundstykker og brød.

text: I want to go to the optician to buy glasses.
translate: Jeg skal til optikeren for å kjøpe briller.

text: I want to go to the supermarket to buy fruit and vegetables.
translate: Jeg skal til supermarkedet for å kjøpe frukt og grønnsaker.

text: I want to go to the baker to buy rolls and bread.
translate: Jeg skal til bakeren for å kjøpe rundstykker og brød.

text: Do the students learn a lot?
Do you often ask the teacher questions?
No, I don’t ask him questions often.
translate: Nei, jeg spør ham ikke ofte.

text: Yes, he is working right now.
translate: Ja, han holder på å jobbe.

text: The man is wearing a hat.
translate: Mannen har på seg en hatt.

text: One cannot see the ears either.
One cannot see his back either.
I am drawing the eyes and the mouth.
The man is dancing and laughing.
The man has a long nose.
He is carrying a cane in his hands.
translate: Han har en stokk i hånden.

text: He is also wearing a scarf around his neck.
translate: Han har dessuten et skjerf rundt halsen.

text: It is winter and it is cold.
translate: Det er vinter og det er kaldt.

text: The man is made of snow.
He is neither wearing pants nor a coat.
translate: Han har ingen bukse på seg og ingen kåpe.

text: But the man is not freezing.

translate: Forstår du de folkene? / Forstår du folk?

text: No, I don’t understand them so well.
translate: Nei, jeg forstår dem ikke så godt.
Har du ei venninne / en kjæreste?

text: I want to make a call.
I want to send an email.
You have to pack our suitcase!
Is there a sheet of paper and a pen here?
translate: Finnes det et ark og en kulepenn her?

text: Don’t forget your traveller’s cheques / traveler’s checks (am.)!
Take some suntan lotion with you.
Take the sun hat with you.
Do you want to take a road map?
translate: Vil du ta med deg bykart?

text: Do you want to take a travel guide?
translate: Vil du ta med deg reiseguide?

text: Do you want to take an umbrella?
translate: Vil du ta med deg paraply?

text: Remember to take pants, shirts and socks.
Remember to take ties, belts and sports jackets.
Remember to take pyjamas, nightgowns and t-shirts.
You need shoes, sandals and boots.
translate: Du trenger sko, sandaler og støvler.

text: You need handkerchiefs, soap and a nail clipper.
translate: Du trenger lommetørkler, såpe og neglesaks.

text: You need a comb, a toothbrush and toothpaste.
translate: Du trenger en kam, en tannbørste og tannkrem.

text: No, it costs only one hundred Euros.
translate: Nei, den koster bare hundre euro.

text: Do you want some more soup?

translate: Nei takk, jeg vil ikke ha mer.
Men jeg vil ha mer is.

text: But I already know a lot of people.
translate: Men jeg kjenner mange folk allerede.

text: Where has he left his glasses?
translate: Hvor har han brillene sine da?

text: But I will be back on Sunday.
translate: Men jeg kommer tilbake allerede på søndagen.

text: But she already has a boyfriend.
translate: Men hun har allerede en kjæreste.

text: The clock hangs on the wall.

translate: Hvor har han passet sitt da?

text: The children cannot find their parents.
translate: Barna kan ikke finne foreldrene sine.
Men der er jo foreldrene deres!

text: How was your trip, Mr. Miller?
Where is your wife, Mr. Miller?
How was your trip, Mrs. Smith?
Where is your husband, Mrs. Smith?
translate: Hvor er mannen din, fru Smidt?

text: What do you want to do?
Do you want to play football / soccer (am.)?
Do you want to visit friends?
I don’t want to arrive late.
translate: Jeg vil ikke komme for sent.

text: I don’t want to go there.
I want to stay at home.
Do you want to stay here?
Do you want to eat here?
Do you want to sleep here?
Do you want to leave tomorrow?
Do you want to stay till tomorrow?
translate: Vil du bli til i morgen?

text: Do you want to pay the bill only tomorrow?
translate: Vil du betale regningen i morgen?

text: Do you want to go to the disco?
Do you want to go to the cinema?
Do you want to go to a café?

text: We must go to work at once.

text: You must wait for the taxi.
Do you know where his key is?
translate: Vet du hvor nøkkelen hans er?

text: Do you know where his ticket is?
translate: Vet du hvor billetten hans er?

text: And her credit card is also gone.
translate: Og kredittkortet hennes er også borte.

text: Where is the football / soccer (am.) field?
My foot and hand also hurt.
translate: Foten og hånden min verker også.

text: I have a car / an automobile.
I also have a jacket and a pair of jeans.
translate: Jeg har også en jakke og en dongeribukse.

text: I have a knife, a fork and a spoon.
translate: Jeg har en kniv, en gaffel og en skje.

text: Where is the salt and pepper?
I am not coming because the weather is so bad.
translate: Jeg kommer ikke fordi været er så dårlig.

text: He isn’t coming because he isn’t invited.
translate: Han kommer ikke fordi han ikke er invitert.

text: I am not coming because I have no time.
translate: Jeg kommer ikke fordi jeg ikke har tid.

text: I am not staying because I still have to work.
translate: Jeg kan ikke bli, fordi jeg må jobbe.
Jeg går fordi jeg er trett.

text: I’m going because it is already late.
translate: Jeg kjører fordi det er sent.

text: The pictures are on the CD.
The pictures are in the camera.
Can you clean the pants / trousers?
Do you have a match or a lighter?
translate: Har du fyrstikker eller en lighter?

text: 70 years ago he was still young.
translate: For sytti år siden var han ung.

text: A woman who weighs a hundred kilos is fat.
translate: En kvinne på hundre kilo er tykk.

text: A man who weighs fifty kilos is thin.
translate: En mann på femti kilo er tynn.

text: I didn’t come because I was ill.
translate: Jeg kom ikke fordi jeg var syk.

text: She didn’t come because she was tired.
translate: Hun kom ikke fordi hun var trett.

text: He didn’t come because he wasn’t interested.
translate: Han kom ikke fordi han ikke hadde lyst.

text: We didn’t come because our car is damaged.
translate: Vi kom ikke fordi bilen vår er ødelagt.

text: They didn’t come because they missed the train.
translate: De kom ikke fordi de ikke rakk toget.

text: I didn’t come because I was not allowed to.
translate: Jeg kom ikke fordi jeg ikke fikk lov.

text: I am wearing a blue dress.
translate: Jeg har en blå kjole på meg.

text: I am wearing a red dress.
translate: Jeg har en rød kjole på meg.

text: I am wearing a green dress.
translate: Jeg har en grønn kjole på meg.

text: An old lady lives at the top.
translate: Der oppe bor det en gammel dame.

text: A fat lady lives at the top.
translate: Der oppe bor det en tjukk dame.
Der nede bor det en nysgjerrig dame.

text: Are you already allowed to drive?
translate: Har du lov til å kjøre bil?

text: Are you already allowed to drink alcohol?
translate: Har du lov til å drikke alkohol?

text: But the neighbours have naughty children.
Are you already allowed to travel abroad alone?
translate: Har du lov til å reise alene til utlandet?
Er det lov å røyke her?

text: May one pay by credit card?
May one pay by cheque / check (am.)?
May one only pay in cash?
May I just make a call?
translate: Får jeg lov til å ringe noen?
Får jeg lov til å spørre noe?
Får jeg lov til å si noe?

text: He is not allowed to sleep in the park.
translate: Han har ikke lov til å sove i parken.

text: He is staying in a hotel.
He is staying in a cheap hotel.
translate: Han bor på et billig hotell.

text: He is not allowed to sleep in the car.
translate: Han har ikke lov til å sove i bilen.

text: He is not allowed to sleep at the train station.
translate: Han har ikke lov til å sove på togstasjonen.
Får vi lov til å sette oss?
Kan vi betale hver for oss?

text: He is reading a boring novel.
She is watching an exciting movie.
translate: Hun ser på en spennende film.

text: Would you like to go for a walk?

translate: Jeg vil gjerne ha noe å drikke.

text: I want to relax a little.
I want to ask you something.
translate: Jeg vil gjerne spørre deg noe.

text: I want to ask you for something.
translate: Jeg vil gjerne be deg om noe.

text: I want to treat you to something.
translate: Jeg vil gjerne invitere deg på noe.

text: Or do you prefer a tea?
translate: Eller vil du heller ha en te?

text: They want to make a call.
Why aren’t you eating the cake?
I’m not eating it because I must lose weight.
translate: Jeg spiser den ikke fordi jeg må slanke meg.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the beer?
I’m not drinking it because I have to drive.
translate: Jeg drikker (det) ikke fordi jeg må kjøre.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the coffee?
I’m not drinking it because it is cold.
translate: Jeg drikker den ikke fordi den er kald.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the tea?
I’m not drinking it because I don’t have any sugar.
translate: Jeg drikker den ikke fordi jeg ikke har sukker.

text: Why aren’t you eating the soup?
I’m not eating it because I didn’t order it.
translate: Jeg spiser den ikke fordi jeg ikke har bestilt den.

text: Why don’t you eat the meat?
I’m not eating it because I am a vegetarian.
translate: Jeg spiser det ikke fordi jeg er vegetarianer.

text: I was talking on the phone all the time.

translate: Jeg har lært / lest hele kvelden.

text: How did you pass the exam?
How did you find the way?
With whom did you make an appointment?
translate: Hvem har du gjort avtale med?

text: With whom did you celebrate your birthday?
translate: Hvem har du feiret bursdag med?

text: What did you come to know?
We had to water the flowers.
We had to clean the apartment.
We had to wash the dishes.
Did you have to pay the bill?
Did you have to pay an entrance fee?
Did you have to pay a fine?
Who had to go home early?
Who had to take the train?
We did not want to stay long.
We did not want to drink anything.
We did not want to disturb you.
I just wanted to make a call.
I just wanted to call a taxi.
Actually I wanted to drive home.
I thought you wanted to call your wife.
translate: Jeg trodde du ville ringe kona di.

text: I thought you wanted to call information.
translate: Jeg trodde du ville ringe opplysningen.

text: I thought you wanted to order a pizza.
translate: Jeg trodde du ville bestille en pizza.

text: My son did not want to play with the doll.
translate: Sønnen min ville ikke leke med dukka.

text: My daughter did not want to play football / soccer (am.).
translate: Dattera mi ville ikke spille fotball.

text: My wife did not want to play chess with me.
translate: Kona mi ville ikke spille sjakk med meg.

text: My children did not want to go for a walk.
translate: Barna mine ville ikke gå tur.

text: They did not want to tidy the room.
translate: De ville ikke rydde på rommet sitt.

text: They did not want to go to bed.
He was not allowed to eat ice cream.
translate: Han fikk ikke lov til å spise is.

text: He was not allowed to eat chocolate.
translate: Han fikk ikke lov til å spise sjokolade.

text: He was not allowed to eat sweets.
translate: Han fikk ikke lov til å spise drops.

text: I was allowed to make a wish.
translate: Jeg fikk lov til å ønske meg noe.

text: I was allowed to buy myself a dress.
translate: Jeg fikk lov til å kjøpe meg en kjole.

text: I was allowed to take a chocolate.
translate: Jeg fikk lov til å ta en sjokolade.

text: Were you allowed to smoke in the airplane?
Were you allowed to drink beer in the hospital?
translate: Fikk du drikke øl på sykehuset?

text: Were you allowed to take the dog into the hotel?
translate: Fikk du ta med hunden på hotellet?

text: You are so lazy – don’t be so lazy!
translate: Du er lat – du burde ta deg sammen.

text: You sleep for so long – don’t sleep so late!
translate: Du sover for lenge – du må lære deg å stå opp om morgenen.

text: You come home so late – don’t come home so late!
translate: Du kommer så sent – du må slutte å komme for sent.

text: You laugh so loudly – don’t laugh so loudly!
translate: Du ler alltid så høyt – det synes jeg du skulle moderere.

text: You speak so softly – don’t speak so softly!
translate: Du snakker så lavt – snakk høyere!

text: During the holidays the children were allowed to remain outside late.
translate: I ferien fikk barna lov til å være ute lenge.

text: They were allowed to play in the yard for a long time.
translate: De fikk leke i hagen / på tunet lenge.

text: They were allowed to stay up late.
You drink too much – don’t drink so much!
translate: Du drikker for mye – drikk mindre da!

text: You smoke too much – don’t smoke so much!
translate: Du røyker for mye – ikke røyk så mye da!

text: You work too much – don’t work so much!
translate: Du jobber for mye – ikke jobb så mye da!

text: You drive too fast – don’t drive so fast!
translate: Du kjører for fort – ikke kjør så fort da!

text: Which newspaper did you subscribe to?
translate: Hvilken avis har du abonnert på?

text: Why did you become a teacher?
Why did you take a taxi?
She took a piece of chocolate.
He was disloyal, but she was loyal.
translate: Han var utro, men hun var trofast.

text: He was lazy, but she was hard-working.
translate: Han var lat, men hun var flittig.

text: He was poor, but she was rich.
translate: Han var fattig, men hun var rik.

text: He had no money, only debts.
translate: Han hadde ingen penger, men gjeld.

text: He had no luck, only bad luck.
translate: Han hadde ikke flaks, men uflaks.
Pass på deg selv! / Ta vare på deg selv!

text: He had no success, only failure.
translate: Han lyktes ikke, men han mislyktes.

text: He was not satisfied, but dissatisfied.
translate: Han var ikke fornøyd, men misfornøyd.

text: He was not happy, but sad.
translate: Han var ikke lykkelig, men ulykkelig.

text: He was not friendly, but unfriendly.
translate: Han var ikke sympatisk, men usympatisk.
Det irriterer meg at du snorker.

text: I’m angry that you drink so much beer.
translate: Det irriterer meg at du drikker så mye øl.

text: I’m angry that you come so late.
translate: Det irriterer meg at du kommer så sent.

text: I think he needs a doctor.
translate: Jeg tror (at) han trenger en lege.

text: I think he is sleeping now.
We hope that he marries our daughter.
translate: Vi håper (at) han vil gifte seg med dattera vår.

text: We hope that he has a lot of money.
translate: Vi håper (at) han har mye penger.

text: We hope that he is a millionaire.
I heard that your wife had an accident.
translate: Jeg har hørt at kona di hadde en ulykke.

text: I heard that she is in the hospital.
translate: Jeg har hørt at hun ligger på sykehuset.

text: I heard that your car is completely wrecked.
translate: Jeg har hørt at bilen din er totalt ødelagt.
Jeg er glad for at du kom.

text: I’m happy that you are interested.
translate: Det gleder meg at du er interessert.

text: I’m happy that you want to buy the house.
translate: Det gleder meg at du vil kjøpe huset.

text: I’m afraid the last bus has already gone.
translate: Jeg er redd for at den siste bussen har gått.

text: I’m afraid we will have to take a taxi.
translate: Jeg er redd for at vi må ta en drosje.

text: I’m afraid I have no more money.
translate: Jeg er redd for at jeg ikke har penger med meg.

text: I don’t know if he loves me.
translate: Jeg vet ikke om han elsker meg.

text: I don’t know if he’ll come back.
translate: Jeg vet ikke om han kommer tilbake.

text: I don’t know if he’ll call me.
translate: Jeg vet ikke om han vil ringe meg.

text: I wonder if he thinks about me.
translate: Jeg lurer på om han tenker på meg.

text: I wonder if he has someone else.
translate: Jeg lurer på om han har ei annen.
Jeg lurer på om han lyver.

text: Maybe he tells me the truth?
I doubt whether he really likes me.
translate: Jeg er i tvil på om han virkelig liker meg.

text: I doubt whether he’ll write to me.
translate: Jeg er i tvil på om han vil skrive til meg.

text: I doubt whether he’ll marry me.
translate: Jeg er i tvil på om han vil gifte seg med meg.
Om han vil skrive til meg?
Om han vil gifte seg med meg?
Vent til det har sluttet å regne.

text: I’ll wait until my hair is dry.
translate: Jeg venter til håret mitt er tørt.

text: I’ll wait until the film is over.
translate: Jeg venter til filmen er over.

text: I’ll wait until the traffic light is green.
translate: Jeg venter til lyset er grønt.

text: When do you go on holiday?
Yes, before the summer holidays begin.
Repair the roof before the winter begins.
Wash your hands before you sit at the table.
translate: Vask hendene før du setter deg ved bordet.

text: Close the window before you go out.
translate: Lukk vinduet før du går ut.

text: Yes, after the class is over.
translate: Ja, etter at undervisningen er over.

text: After he had an accident, he could not work anymore.
translate: Etter at han hadde hatt en ulykke kunne han ikke jobbe lenger.

text: After he had lost his job, he went to America.
translate: Etter at han hadde mistet jobben dro han til Amerika.

text: After he went to America, he became rich.
translate: Etter at han hadde dratt til Amerika ble han rik.

text: Since when is she no longer working?
Yes, she is no longer working since she got married.
translate: Ja, hun har ikke jobbet siden hun ble gift.

text: Since she got married, she’s no longer working.
translate: Siden hun ble gift jobber hun ikke lenger.

text: Since they have met each other, they are happy.
translate: Siden de kjenner hverandre er de lykkelige.

text: Since they have had children, they rarely go out.
translate: Siden de har barn går de sjelden ut.
Hun telefonerer mens hun kjører bil.

text: She watches TV while she irons.
translate: Hun ser på TV mens hun stryker tøy.

text: She listens to music while she does her work.
translate: Hun hører på musikk mens hun gjør oppgavene sine.

text: I can’t see anything when I don’t have glasses.
translate: Jeg ser ingenting når jeg ikke har på meg briller.

text: I can’t understand anything when the music is so loud.
translate: Jeg forstår ingenting når musikken er så høy.

text: I can’t smell anything when I have a cold.
translate: Jeg lukter ingenting når jeg er forkjølet.

text: We’ll take a taxi if it rains.
translate: Vi tar en drosje hvis det regner.

text: We’ll travel around the world if we win the lottery.
translate: Vi reiser jorden rundt hvis vi vinner i lotto.

text: We’ll start eating if he doesn’t come soon.
translate: Vi begynner å spise hvis han ikke kommer snart.

text: Perhaps the weather will get better tomorrow.
translate: Kanskje det blir bedre vær i morgen.

text: I hope that it gets better.
translate: Jeg håper at det blir bedre.

text: Do you know that for sure?
I think that it is old.
translate: Jeg antar at den er gammel.
Jeg synes at han ser veldig flott ut.

text: The boss definitely has a girlfriend.
It is very possible that he has a girlfriend.
translate: Det er godt mulig at han har en kjæreste.

text: I get up as soon as the alarm rings.
translate: Jeg står opp så snart vekkerklokka ringer.

text: I become tired as soon as I have to study.
translate: Jeg blir trett så snart jeg skal lære.

text: I will stop working as soon as I am 60.
translate: Jeg slutter å jobbe når jeg blir seksti.

text: As soon as I have a moment.
He’ll call, as soon as he has a little time.
translate: Han ringer så snart han har tid.

text: I’ll work as long as I can.
translate: Jeg skal jobbe så lenge jeg kan.

text: I’ll work as long as I am healthy.
translate: Jeg skal jobbe så lenge jeg er frisk.

text: He lies in bed instead of working.
translate: Han ligger i senga i stedet for å jobbe.

text: She reads the newspaper instead of cooking.
translate: Hun leser avisen i stedet for å lage mat.

text: He is at the bar instead of going home.
translate: Han sitter på puben i stedet for å gå hjem.

text: As far as I know, he lives here.
translate: Så vidt jeg vet bor han her.

text: As far as I know, his wife is ill.
translate: Så vidt jeg vet er kona hans syk.

text: As far as I know, he is unemployed.
translate: Så vidt jeg vet er han arbeidsledig.

text: I overslept; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Jeg hadde kommet tidsnok dersom jeg ikke hadde forsovet meg.

text: I missed the bus; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Jeg hadde kommet tidsnok hvis jeg ikke hadde mistet bussen.

text: I didn’t find the way / I got lost; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Jeg kom ikke i tide fordi jeg ikke fant veien.
Jeg har svart på alle spørsmålene.

text: I know that – I knew that.
translate: Jeg vet det – jeg har visst det.

text: I write that – I wrote that.
translate: Jeg skriver det – jeg har skrevet det.

text: I hear that – I heard that.
translate: Jeg hører det – jeg har hørt det.

text: I’ll get it – I got it.
translate: Jeg henter det – jeg har hentet det.

text: I’ll bring that – I brought that.
translate: Jeg bringer det – jeg har brakt det.

text: I’ll buy that – I bought that.
translate: Jeg kjøper det – jeg har kjøpt det.

text: I expect that – I expected that.
translate: Jeg forventer det – jeg har forventet det.

text: I’ll explain that – I explained that.
translate: Jeg forklarer det – jeg har forklart det.

text: I know that – I knew that.
translate: Jeg kjenner det – jeg har kjent det.

text: Did you have to call an ambulance?
Did you have to call the doctor?
Did you have to call the police?
Do you have the telephone number? I had it just now.
translate: Har du nummeret? Jeg hadde det i sted.

text: Do you have the address? I had it just now.
translate: Har du adressen? Jeg hadde den i sted.

text: Do you have the city map? I had it just now.
translate: Har du bykartet? Jeg hadde det i sted.

text: Did he come on time? He could not come on time.
translate: Kom han i tide? Han klarte ikke å komme i tide.

text: Did he find the way? He could not find the way.
translate: Fant han veien? Han fant ikke veien.

text: Did he understand you? He could not understand me.
translate: Forstod han deg? Han kunne ikke forstå meg.

text: Why could you not come on time?
translate: Hvorfor kunne du ikke komme i tide?

text: Why could you not find the way?
Why could you not understand him?
I could not come on time because there were no buses.
translate: Jeg kom ikke i tide fordi det gikk ikke buss.

text: I could not find the way because I had no city map.
translate: Jeg fant ikke veien fordi jeg ikke hadde kart.

text: I could not understand him because the music was so loud.
translate: Jeg kunne ikke forstå ham fordi musikken var så høy.

text: I had to take a taxi.
I had to buy a city map.
I had to switch off the radio.
The journey was beautiful, but too tiring.
translate: Reisen var fin, men den var for anstrengende.

text: The train was on time, but too full.
translate: Toget var punktlig, men det var for fullt.

text: The hotel was comfortable, but too expensive.
translate: Hotellet var koselig, men det var for dyrt.

text: He’ll take either the bus or the train.
translate: Han tar enten bussen eller toget.

text: He’ll come either this evening or tomorrow morning.
translate: Han kommer enten i kveld eller i morgen tidlig.

text: He’s going to stay either with us or in the hotel.
translate: Han bor enten hos oss eller på hotellet.

text: She speaks Spanish as well as English.
translate: Hun snakker både spansk og engelsk.

text: She has lived in Madrid as well as in London.
translate: Hun har bodd i både Madrid og London.

text: She knows Spain as well as England.
translate: Hun kjenner både Spania og England.

text: He is not only stupid, but also lazy.
translate: Han er ikke bare dum, men også lat.

text: She is not only pretty, but also intelligent.
translate: Hun er ikke bare pen, men også intelligent.

text: She speaks not only German, but also French.
translate: Hun snakker ikke bare tysk, men også fransk.

text: I can neither play the piano nor the guitar.
translate: Jeg spiller verken piano eller gitar.

text: I can neither waltz nor do the samba.
translate: Jeg danser verken vals eller samba.

text: I like neither opera nor ballet.
translate: Jeg liker verken opera eller ballett.

text: The faster you work, the earlier you will be finished.
translate: Jo fortere du jobber, desto fortere blir du ferdig.

text: The earlier you come, the earlier you can go.
translate: Jo tidligere du kommer, desto tidligere kan du gå.

text: The older one gets, the more complacent one gets.
translate: Jo eldre man blir, desto tryggere blir man.

text: He fell asleep although the TV was on.
translate: Han sovnet, selv om TVen sto på.

text: He stayed a while although it was late.
translate: Han ble, selv om det var sent.

text: He didn’t come although we had made an appointment.
translate: Han kom ikke, selv om vi hadde avtale.

text: The TV was on. Nevertheless, he fell asleep.
translate: TVen sto på, men likevel sovnet han.

text: It was already late. Nevertheless, he stayed a while.
translate: Det var sent, men likevel ble han.

text: We had made an appointment. Nevertheless, he didn’t come.
translate: Vi hadde en avtale. Likevel kom han ikke.

text: Although he has no license, he drives the car.
translate: Han kjører bil selv om han ikke har førerkort.

text: Although the road is slippery, he drives so fast.
translate: Selv om veien er glatt kjører han fort.

text: Although he is drunk, he rides his bicycle.
translate: Han sykler selv om han er full.

text: Despite having no licence / license (am.), he drives the car.
translate: Han har ikke førerkort. Likevel kjører han bil.

text: Despite the road being slippery, he drives fast.
translate: Veien er glatt. Likevel kjører han så fort.

text: Despite being drunk, he rides the bike.
translate: Han er full. Likevel sykler han.

text: Although she went to college, she can’t find a job.
translate: Hun finner ingen stilling selv om hun har studert.

text: Although she is in pain, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: Hun går ikke til legen selv om hun har smerter.

text: Although she has no money, she buys a car.
translate: Hun kjøper bil selv om hun ikke har penger.

text: She went to college. Nevertheless, she can’t find a job.
translate: Hun har studert. Likevel finner hun ingen stilling.

text: She is in pain. Nevertheless, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: Hun har smerter. Likevel går hun ikke til legen.

text: She has no money. Nevertheless, she buys a car.
translate: Hun har ingen penger. Likevel kjøper hun bil.

text: Have you already been to Berlin?
translate: Har du noen gang vært i Berlin?

text: No, I don’t know anyone here.
a little longer – not much longer
Will you stay here a little longer?
translate: Skal du være her ennå en stund?

text: No, I won’t stay here much longer.
translate: Nei, jeg skal ikke være her lenger.

text: Would you like to drink something else?
No, I don’t want anything else.
translate: Nei takk, jeg vil ikke ha mer.

text: No, I haven’t eaten anything yet.
translate: Nei, jeg har ikke spist noe ennå.

text: Does anyone else want a coffee?
translate: Er det flere som vil ha kaffe?
min vennines katt / katten til vennina mi
min venns hund / hunden til vennen min
mine barns leketøy / leketøyet til barna mine
Det er kåpen til kollegaen min.
Det er bilen til kollegaen min.
Det er min kollegas jobb. / Det er jobben til kollegaen min.

text: The button from the shirt is gone.
The boss’ computer is not working.

translate: Hvor er foreldrene til jenta? / Hvor er jentas foreldre?

text: How do I get to her parents’ house?
translate: Hvordan kommer jeg til hennes foreldres hus?

text: The house is at the end of the road.
translate: Huset er i enden av gata.

text: What is the name of the capital city of Switzerland?
What is the title of the book?
What are the names of the neighbour’s / neighbor’s (am.) children?
translate: Hva heter naboenes barn? / Hva heter barna til naboene?
Når er barnas skoleferie? / Når er skoleferien til barna?

text: What are the doctor’s consultation times?
translate: Hva er legens kontortid? / Hva er kontortida til legen?

text: What time is the museum open?
translate: Hva er åpningstidene til museet? / Hva er museets åpningstider?
